glsa.title: Real VNC: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: The Real VNC client is vulnerable to execution of arbitrary code when connecting to a malicious server.

background.p: Real VNC is a remote desktop viewer display system.

description.p: An unspecified vulnerability has been discovered int the CMsgReader::readRect() function in the VNC Viewer component, related to the encoding type of RFB protocol data.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious VNC server, or leverage Man-in-the-Middle attacks, to cause the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the VNC viewer.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
